content_parts.content:
From the Transaction workbench, you can view open customer invoices for the current bank feed and select those you want to pay. The payment is sent to Sage Intacct.

If there are no customer invoices for the current bank feed, you can create an AR advance for a customer and send it to Sage Intacct.

content_parts.title: Manage entity-level data for multi-entity general account structures

content_parts.content:
• Journal entry and AR invoice searches are limited to the related level.
  • Journal entries are generated at the entity level.
  • Duplicate entries can be unlinked.
  • When the Transaction workbench switches to asynchronous mode, you need to rerun the matching rules. This removes the posting checkboxes and only lines ready for posting are considered.

Use Bank Manager to automatically match to open customer invoices for the current bank feed. If at least one possible match with the bank transaction feed is found, the Accounts receivable matching page displays and selects all invoices for that customer by due date. If there are no matches, all AR invoices for that customer display.
In Bank Manager, you have access to additional record statuses and you can manage bank feeds asynchronously when there are more than 100 lines.

content_parts.content: For average cost items, the stock journal shows the order cost equal to the valued cost and order amount equal to the movement amount for all transactions.

On the Notification history page, you can view the following integration statuses for Avalara:

  • Tax calculations for sales invoices and sales credit notes when creating and updating
  • Final Tax calculation for sales invoices and sales credit notes when posting
  • Company queries
  • Entity use queries
  • Tax code queries

You can perform detailed stock allocations on sales order lines. When the order ships, these allocations are transferred to the related shipment lines.

You don't have to allocate stock on sales order lines before shipment. You can allocate stock on shipment lines if you prefer.

For standard cost valued items, the stock journal entry for receipts calculates and records the difference between the actual and standard cost as the non-absorbed amount.

Subsequent cost variances, relative to the original receipt, generate a value correction in the stock journal entry.

content_parts.content:
You can assign or create categories for new work orders. Predefined categories include Normal and Assembly or Rework for work orders with or without components and operations respectively. 

For existing work orders, you can add a routing and/or bill of material, and add unplanned operations and components.
The Stock detailed inquiry provides stock data for individual items per site. Data includes stock levels, stock status, lot details, and serial number data.

content_parts.title: Component allocation from work orders and material tracking

content_parts.content: You can allocate stock from a Work order and from Material tracking. Select Allocate stock from the More actions icon for a component line to allocate stock from individual locations. The work order and material tracking component line displays the Allocation status.

content_parts.title: Onboarding email notifications for functional administrators

content_parts.content:
When you begin your subscription, email notifications keep you informed of important events.

  1. As soon as your tenant is up and running, you’re notified so you can begin administrative tasks without delay.
  2. You receive an email when you add users to a tenant. After that, you have options on how and when to notify your users of their access to the tenant.
Create dashboards to keep track of key data such as sales, purchase orders, and more. You can start with a predefined template and customise as needed or build your own dashboard.
